metadata.Title: CVE-2005-1514 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
commands.c in qmail, when running on 64 bit platforms with a large amountof virtual memory, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service andpossibly execute arbitrary code via a long SMTP command without a spacecharacter, which causes an array to be referenced with a negative index.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2005-1514` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qmail - 1.06-6.2~deb10u1build0.20.04.1
qmail-uids-gids - 1.06-6.2~deb10u1build0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netqmail package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.06-6.2~deb10u1build0.20.04.1').
